attributes.action: Put Edmund the Martyr on a banknote!
attributes.additional_details: The history of Anglo-Saxon England is a neglected subject in today's Britain, and having a banknote depicting one of its most famous Kings would be an excellent way to make it more familiar to the general public.
attributes.background: I petition for a banknote bearing the likeness of Edmund the Martyr, king of East Anglia and original patron saint of the English, who was slain by the Vikings in AD 869.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of the Bank of England, which is independent of the UK Government and Parliament.

You can find out more information on this website:
http://www.bankofengland.co.uk/banknotes/Pages/characters/advisorycommittee.aspx
